sandisk 16 gb pendrive review
An amazing Value for money product
review:
Good product

Pros:  
1\. A Value for money. Best pendrive at this cost.  
2\. Performance is good- as expected within this rate.  
3\. A Trusted & Safe storage device for files by Sandisk- there is minimum
chance of device malfunction and losing your data.  
4\. I have been using this for more than 3 years and its still giving Good
performance. So, its very Long-lasting.  
5\. Delivery by Amazon was very good- delivered on-time and very well packed.  
  
Cons:  
1\. Slow data transfer speed- 25 mbps export & 4 mbps import ( it's bit low,
but OK within this budget)  
  
Sandisk is one of the most Trusted & Popular companies for storage devices in
the world. This product by them is also Good. I was fully satisfied with this
pendrive at this low price. You can undoubtedly go for this device within this
Budget.  
If you like this review please give a Helpful vote...it helps.

THE GOOD: Reliable brand, acceptable read speeds averaging at 32MB/s
(considering it's USB2), stability check passes with no errors (see attached
screenshot), have another 8GB cruzerblade that's been used for like 2 whole
years and it still performs as new- hope this will turn out to be as durable.  
  
THE BAD: Slow write speed. The device writes at 4 to 6 MB/s maximum (using a
Windows 10 laptop with i7 5500U CPU, Nvidia GTX 940M GPU, and 16GB RAM, with
the drive plugged in a USB 3 port). The drive tends to heat up during
operation which my older cruzerblade doesn't. The older 8GB cruzerblade stays
cool even when used constantly for moving data (hours at a time), but this new
drive heats up within 10 minutes of ANY read/write operation using the same
pair of computers. The good news (I guess) is that I have an HP w220v flash
drive and that heats up as well- it's been heating up for like 4 years, and it
still works- heat will probably not damage the device (unless it's heating
like a stove,, which it isn't).  
  
THE UGLY: The seller called me and asked me to cancel the order, claiming his
warehouse has burned down and if he cancels the order on his own he will be
"fined" by Amazon for not fulfilling his commitment. This is very weird- I've
been shopping online for years and no seller has ever called me up. I called
Amazon to check, Amazon customer care asked me not to cancel the order. I did
not cancel and the product was eventually delivered (before promised date).
This was an unique incident, and the chances of this repeating with your order
is infinitesimally small.  
  
USABLE CAPACITY: 14.5 GB  
  
BOTTOM LINE: At this price, you cannot lose. Even if it goes bad, SanDisk is a
genuine brand and it comes with a 5 years warranty- you can always call up
SanDisk and request assistance. Go for it.

Sand disk is known for affordable pendrives and this is just an example of
that.  
The build quality SUCKS to be honest but that's what you get when you pay
somuch for a 16 gigs storage.  
Sand disk pendrives are known to break at the insertion tip and hence wouldn't
recommend this is you are looking for a pendrive with a good build quality.
The read write speeds are on par with the standards of USB 3.0 and may change
based on the type of file being copied.

Bought it during sale but paid pretty much the same amount as i would have
without the sale.  
Next coming to the product  
1\. works no issues there,  
2\. read and write speeds are as they should be - Never expect the highest
speeds that are written as that depends on may other factors,  
3\. the drive itself is extremely tight at this point maybe it will loosen up
after constant use. This is not a bad or good thing for me personally its a
bit of a nuisance to have to pull it with force  
4\. the only CON i found was heating - It heats up regardless of the size of
data transfer. I transfer a 56kb image it heats up, i transfer 400 mb it heats
up.  
  
Do not know if this is gonna cause issues in the future because this is the
first flash drive that has heating issues that i have used.  
If i had an infra red camera i would should you in pictures but i don't have
that.

better buy if we compare price and Value 4 money

best device. even though I dropped it in tub of water several times and mom
washed it with clothes along times...still it works and Data transfer speed

Got it from cloudtail india @249, checked the pendrive originality with
RMpreusb quick size test and with h2testw which proved pen drive size of
14922MB, read speed 4mbps and write 27Mbps on FAT32, for improving speed u can
format it as NTFS, use Fastcopy software(with buffer more than or =
1023Mb,depends on your RAM) default is 64Kb. BOOM! Big files are copied in few
seconds or minutes. Package was made in Malaysia, and 16GB pen drives are
never 16GB, it is approx 14.5 or 14.8GB, same logic goes for 32 or 8Gb, plz
dnt post misleading reviews.

I just got this product just a few hours ago and I must say its really small,
yet rugged. It is so small that if you are not careful enough to slide a
lanyard around it, you are likely to lose it. My primary purpose of buying the
flash drive is to play music on my TV and the bundled encryption software was
initially a hassle. There was an easy remedy - just place the files outside
the encryption vault and you are good.  
  
I decided to buy this on Amazon after I compared price of this product on
Flipkart. It was around Rs 50 cheaper on Amazon. Having experienced Flipkart's
speedy delivery service before, I wasn't sure if Amazon would be able to match
it but I was willing to give it a try. And to my surprise, it reached me in
two days(though it was estimated to arrive three days later). Thank you,
Amazon. You saved me time and money:).

review:
Functional as described.  
reasonable transfer speed. Depends on file sizes. Large files transfer at

windows XP but much slower for windows 7 and onwards. Better go for usb
supporting higher version. However it's reliable with no connection issue and
detects fast.

I purchased this 16GB on 21st August 2014 at the price of 370rs. It was the
cheapest pendrive available at that time. I use this pendrive regularly for
copying movies, installing softwares and OS etc. I partitioned the drives for
installing kali linux as live. And recovered the pendrive. So after these
heavy usage also this works fine. It did't show me an error message till this
day.  
  
Speed :  
I tested the speed of the pendrive in my Macbook pro and attached the
screenshot. It shows me 8mb/s for writing and 23mb/s for reading the data.
It's not bad. You will get 4-10mb/s as write speed.  
  
At this cost this pendrive gives lot of advantages. You can buy without having
a second mind.  
If you want more speed than this,then you can go for USB 3.0 drives.

Bought this second time.  
* Good product for 1-2 years.  
* My previous flash drive is not working after 2 years approx. (Showing not initialized on the disk management utility even after initializing the drive it is still hidden from My Computer window.

Best pen drive compared to all available in the market.

The flash drive I've received is having total capacity of 15,631,122,432 bytes
as reported by Linux's "fdisk -l" command. I ran the test suite downloaded
from usb.userbenchmark.com (ran it on Windows) and it gave my flash drive rank
366 vs average rank 383 of SanDisk Cruzer Blade 16GB (
http://usb.userbenchmark.com/SpeedTest/1349/SanDisk-Cruzer-Blade ). I'm having
problems with behavior of SanDisk customer care, they have wasted a lot of my
time and seems like they don't care.

SanDisk has always been my first choice. They have never proved me wrong.
SanDisk Blade is an indestructible product.

Have used sandisk for a long time and i can say this one won't disappoint
either! Heated up a little more than usual during formatting once but now
seems to work just fine...  
Edit: Now that it has been 6 months, I thought maybe I should update my
review. Sandisk still works well but the heating is becoming an issue. Data
transfer for a couple of minutes and it starts to heat up. On the contrary, my
friend's HP pen drive works very cool and you won't even feel it's temperature
despite it have a metallic body. In conclusion, Sandisk is good but if you
have already had one I would prefer to look for other options and experiment a
little to find my perfect pen drive

Very good pen drive with high data transfer speed
review:
I have been using a similar drive of 4GB capacity from last 2 years. The drive
was purchased for my office and its working absolutely fine with several
writes each day. I was using this drive to test the software developed for our
office product where I had to write huge amount of machine data every 1 hour.
The tests were done for almost 3 months. The drive is still working fine after
so much of writes.  
  
The plastic quality is bit cheap and the USB socket is prone to break quite
easily as the corners of the plastic are very slim. All in all, if you use it
wisely and does not get it crushed beneath heavy objects, it will work
superbly.  
Read and Write speeds are well for a normal day to day work. Nothing special
in it, but its build to last electronically quite a few years.  
  
Being a satisfied user of the 4GB version which was for office use, I ordered
a personal one of 16GB just recently because I had to consume the amount in my
prepaid card.  
  
If you are looking for simple, build to last (functionality wise), for day-to-
day copy needs, normal size of data transfers, go for it.  
If you want metallic finish, robust build quality, or a large data transfer
every now and then, look for Kingston Drives. They are tough in structure, but
R/W speeds are less compared to similarly priced products.

the pen drive is ok.  
its been reliable. but speed is slow for a 16gb pen drive.  
more than 8gb you should buy a USB 3.0 Pen Drive to get good speeds, unless
its for archiving something important band you wont be writing to it again and
again.  
  
PS: I didnt know this before but i have observed that USB 3.0 drives function
faster even on USB 2.0 ports, so there IS an advantage even if you dont have
USB 3.0 port on your desktop/ laptop.

It is a good one speed wise. But this type of Pen drives have a major problem
. Its body is prone to cracks quite easily. It may crack even when it is
dropped on the floor from our hands. The part which we plug into the USB port
is more easily broken and small pieces are fallen off so we cant plug it into
the port anymore. I bought two pendrives last month, one has already become
useless already. So never buy this type of Pendrives.Buy only the ones with
metal body.

I look for reliable pen drive as frequent user I am... I count on it. It gives
me less waiting time while copying or accessing data where I feel it is faster
than others.

files which works on Mac and Windows both whether keeping pics, mp3, videos,
data files or using for OS recovery as bootable the perfect pen drive it is in
all needs... Thanks Amazon for cost saving deal and thanks for protecting via
Amazon Fulfilled which I always look for.  
  
I recommend SanDisk Cruzer 16GB and I like ordering on Amazon always.
